intro: Gonzalagunia panamensis var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy gonzalagunia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which provide a distinctive texture. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. This variety is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
